# Scale: Harmonic in A (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: G)

## Description:
The Harmonic Scale is a seven-note scale that is often used in jazz and fusion music. The Harmonic scale in A with the Locrian #6 mode and G shape is a unique and intriguing scale choice that can add an exotic and mysterious flavor to your musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals:
The A Harmonic scale with the Locrian #6 mode and G shape consists of the following notes and intervals:
- A (Root)
- Bb (Minor 2nd)
- C (Minor 3rd)
- D (Perfect 4th)
- Eb (Diminished 5th)
- F (Minor 6th)
- G# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
This scale is often used in jazz, fusion, and experimental music. Its dissonant intervals and the augmented 2nd between the Eb and F create a tense and mysterious atmosphere. The G# note adds a unique character to the scale, making it stand out in compositions.
